sentences.en: a vote in favor of secession
At 19.5 days, the somatic cloned mice were delivered by Caesarean secession.
sentences.cn: 19.5天后, 通过剖腹产获得体细胞克隆小鼠.

sentences.en: Klimt was a leader in the revolt against the Vienna art establishment known as the Secession.
sentences.cn: 克里姆特曾是反抗维也纳艺术风格的“分立运动”的领袖之一.

sentences.en: Of this nature appears to be the assumed right of secession.
sentences.cn: 擅自的退出权即属于此一性质.

sentences.en: South Carolina passed an " ordinance of secession ", and prepared for war.
sentences.cn: 南卡罗来纳州通过了 “ 脱离联邦法令 ”, 准备打仗.

sentences.en: South Carolina's secession imitated by ten other states and led to the formation of the confederacy.
sentences.cn: 南卡罗来纳州分离出去,其它十个州也分离出去,便导致了联邦的形成.

sentences.en: They established " the Secession " ( stylistically allied with art nouveau ).
sentences.cn: 他们建立起了 “ 分立派 ” ( 从艺术角度来讲,它属于新艺术 ).

sentences.en: This secession was a serious challenge to the new President of the USA, Abraham Lincoln.
sentences.cn: 这种分裂对新任总统亚伯拉罕?林肯是严峻的挑战.

sentences.en: This, they feel, may lay the groundwork for financial independence and secession.
sentences.cn: 他们觉得, 如此可以打下财政独立与成功的基础.

sentences.en: Vienna Secession is a symbolism junta of Vienna in the 19 th century.
sentences.cn: 维也纳“分离画派”是十九世纪奥地利的象征主义派别.

sentences.en: Your days of secession are numbered black brothers.
sentences.cn: 你们离去的日子指日可待了,黑暗的兄弟们.

trans.tran_cn: 退出，脱离，分离，[史](1861年美国南方十一州的)脱离联邦
trans.tran_en: when a country or state officially stops being part of another country and becomes independent
